comments.body: I think these are mostly wrong now, and should probably be updated to the kubernetes-e2e-test-images versions (though not in this PR). cc @mkumatag
Ahh i see that is not easy.
GH seems to get confused by this line touched by two different commits, one changing mounttest and the other mounttest-user.

diffHunk:

    - -c

    securityContext:
      privileged: true

comments.body: The only change here is adding `gcr.io/google_containers/nginx-slim:0.8`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +28,32 @@    - /bin/sh
    - -c

comments.body:
this needs to exit or the pod will continue wasting resources on the node and tests like the resource tracking test will fail waiting for it to stop. Ideally it should exit when the image puller exits. This is why I'd suggested breaking out the for loop in sh -c above into an independent script, and doing your stats collection in between each image pull. 

I'm ok with quick and dirty for now, if your container is just going to do some bounded, small number of queries within eg: 4m, which is roughly how long the image puller will take.
Yes, this is just the seed for a more full featured nethealth monitoring container.
I guess you're setting 100m 100m to get guaranteed qos, this is what ia was asking for confirmation about (that this 100m won't eject any other pods)
Ah, got it, I used the same resource limits as the image-puller container. This is a short lived container, max 30 seconds; it should vacate its reserved CPU before other pods are scheduled.
Can this list be stored in its own file?
Not without added complexity (I previously had it in a salt variable), I view that as lipstick on this pig :)
+1 for not adding any more complexity until we know pre-pulling helps.
